1.speaker: sasako
1.definition: Thank you for all of your hard work.

3.speaker: polar bear
3.character: 明日は　休日だから楽しんできてね
3.definition: Tomorrow's your day off, so enjoy it.

5.speaker: sasako
5.character: このところ毎日冷えますね

7.speaker: sasako
7.character: 帰ったら　ゆっくりお風呂入って 疲れ取ろうっと
7.definition: When I get home, I'm going to take a nice, hot bath and relax.

9.speaker: sasako
9.character: それじゃ　おやすみなさい

11.speaker: polar bear
11.character: 僕も　お風呂は大好きなんだ
11.definition: I love baths, too. Ice baths are the best!

12.speaker: polar bear
12.definition: This may be a little cramped.

13.speaker: polar bear
13.character: 本当は　プカプカ　ユラユラしたいのに
13.definition: I'd like to have more room.

15.speaker: penguin
15.character: おっと　さっきのそばに入ってたにしんは　何匹だった
15.definition: Hey. How many sardines were in that soba?

16.speaker: penguin
16.character: へえ　ニシンが８匹で９　１０　１１…
16.definition: Yes... There were eight sardines and... Nine, ten, eleven...

17.speaker: panda
17.character: どうしたの　ペンギンさん

19.speaker: panda
19.character: なにブツブツ１人でしゃべってるの
19.definition: Why are you mumbling to yourself?

21.speaker: penguin
21.character: パンダ君と一緒にしないで

22.speaker: penguin
22.character: 今　僕がやってたのは『にしんそば』っていう落語でね
22.definition: I was just performing a story called "Sardine Soba."

23.speaker: panda
23.character: 歩きながら食べちゃダメって お母さんに怒られない
23.definition: Won't your mom get mad at you for eating and walking at the same time?

24.speaker: penguin
24.character: 食べてないよ これは落語でね
24.definition: I'm not eating! This is comedic story-telling...

25.speaker: panda
25.character: ペンギンさん目をつぶって歩いていると 人のお家に入っちゃうよ
25.definition: Mr. Penguin. If you walk around with your eyes closed, you might end up in someone else's house.

27.character: だいたい　ちゃんとパッチリ開いてるから
27.definition: Not to mention my eyes are wide open.

28.speaker: panda
28.definition: What? I can't see them at all.

29.speaker: penguin
29.character: そっちだってよくわかんないでしょ
29.definition: Well, we can't really see your eyes, either.

30.speaker: panda
30.character: つぶらな瞳って言ってよ

31.speaker: penguin
31.character: というか　パンダ君がなんでここにいるの
31.definition: Or rather, what are you doing here?

33.speaker: panda
33.character: ペンギンさん　僕んちに何か用
33.definition: Did you need something, Mr. Penguin?

37.character: さっきの話だけど　僕ね
37.definition: Continuing what we were talking about earlier, but I'm thinking about doing some comedic storytelling at a party.

38.speaker: panda
38.character: パーティーも寒くなりそうだね
38.definition: It might get cold at the party, too.

39.speaker: penguin
39.character: キミにしては珍しいウイットはいらないから
39.definition: We don't need the rare witty comment from you.

40.speaker: penguin
40.character: だいたい　なんで寒くなるって決めつけるの
40.definition: Not to mention, how do you know it'll be dull?

41.speaker: penguin
41.character: バカウケするとか考えないわけ
41.definition: You don't think it might actually be super funny?

43.speaker: penguin
43.character: そんなこと言うのはパンダ君だけだよ
43.definition: You're the only one that thinks that.

44.speaker: panda
44.character: じゃあ　誰かに聞いてもらう
44.definition: Then do you want to have someone listen to it?

46.speaker: penguin
46.character: じゃあ　パンダ君　聞いてよ
46.definition: Okay, then listen to this, Panda.

47.speaker: penguin
47.character: え　では毎度ばかばかしい小話を１つ…
47.definition: Well, let's start off with another slightly idiotic tale...

52.speaker: penguin
52.character: シロクマ君　すぐ休んじゃうんだね
52.definition: Polar Bear doesn't hesitate to close up, does he?

53.speaker: penguin
53.definition: You want Polar Bear to listen?

54.speaker: panda
54.character: うん　ペンギンさんのつまんない落語を聞いてもらおうと思って
54.definition: Yeah. I thought we'd have him listen to your boring stories.

55.speaker: penguin
55.character: つまんなくないよ　大爆笑だよあ…

56.speaker: penguin
56.definition: Huh? I wonder what Polar Bear's doing in the yard.

57.speaker: penguin
57.character: 大きな布　持ってるね

58.speaker: panda
58.character: 家出　止めなくちゃ
58.definition: Maybe he's running away? We've got to stop him!

59.speaker: penguin
59.character: パンダ君じゃないんだから

61.speaker: penguin
61.character: 自分の家で何を盗むの
61.definition: What's he going to steal from his own place?

62.speaker: panda
62.character: そうか　わかったよ きっと　サンタさんだ
62.definition: Oh, I know! He must be Santa!

63.speaker: panda
63.character: かついでるのはプレゼントの入った袋だよ
63.definition: What he's holding is his bag of presents!

64.speaker: penguin
64.character: クリスマスは　とっくに過ぎたでしょ
64.definition: Christmas came and went a long time ago!

65.speaker: panda
65.character: きっと僕へのプレゼントが入ってるよ
65.definition: There must be a present for me in there! Hey, wait! Panda?!

67.speaker: polar bear
67.character: うん この木とこの木の距離がちょうどよさそう
67.definition: Yes. The distance between these trees is about perfect. I wonder what's in here. Hey, it's empty.

68.speaker: polar bear
68.character: あれ　パンダ君　ペンギンさん
68.definition: Oh, Panda and Mr. Penguin. Hey.

71.speaker: panda
71.character: うん　これ　プレゼントの袋でしょ
71.definition: Yeah! This is a bag of presents, right?

72.speaker: polar bear
72.character: ああ　これはね 癒やしグッズなんだよ

75.speaker: polar bear
75.character: 木にクッションをあててロープを結ぶっと　そして…
75.definition: I'm going to put a cushion on the tree and then tie this end. And then...

76.speaker: panda
76.character: あっ　ハンモックだ

78.speaker: panda
78.character: ねぇ　シロクマ君　乗ってみていい
78.definition: Hey, Polar Bear, could I get in?

81.speaker: polar bear
81.character: ペンギンさんも　どうぞ
81.definition: You can get in, too, Mr. Penguin.

83.speaker: panda
83.character: ペンギンさん　よかったら先に…
83.definition: Mr. Penguin, if you want, you can go ahead...

85.speaker: panda
85.character: 僕が乗ると こそこで見てていいよ

86.speaker: penguin
86.character: なに　その新しい譲り方

87.speaker: polar bear
87.character: 大きいから一緒に乗れるよ
87.definition: It's big, so we can in together.

91.speaker: polar bear
91.character: ああ　あんまり大きく揺らすと…
91.definition: Oh, if it sways too much...

94.speaker: polar bear
94.character: ハンモックの寝方はね　こう
94.definition: The way you lay in a hammock is... Like this.

95.speaker: polar bear
95.character: まず　中央にそっと座って そのまま後ろにゴロンとする
95.definition: First, you sit in the center carefully, and then roll back.

96.speaker: polar bear
96.character: 横か斜めに寝ると 落ちにくいし 快適だよ
96.definition: If you lay sideways or at an angle, it's harder to slip out and is ideal.

98.speaker: penguin
98.character: 落ちる前に言ってほしかったよ
98.definition: It would've been nice if you had told us that earlier.

101.speaker: penguin
101.character: こういう場所で飲むコーヒーもいいね
101.definition: Having coffee like this isn't bad at all.

106.speaker: panda
106.character: ペンギンさん　そういえば僕たち　何しにきたんだっけ
106.definition: By the way, Mr. Penguin, why did we come here again? Why {\i1}did{\i0} you come here?

108.character: 今度　僕がパーティーでやる予定の落語をね
108.definition: I'm practicing my comedic storytelling for the next party and...

109.speaker: panda
109.character: たしか　どうでもいいことだよ
109.definition: I think it wasn't anything important. What?!

110.speaker: polar bear
110.character: そうか どうでもいいことなんだね
110.definition: I see. So, it wasn't important.

111.speaker: penguin
111.character: あっ　どうでもよくないよ

112.speaker: polar bear
112.character: このユラユラ海に浮かんでいるみたい
112.definition: The way the hammock is swaying, I feel like I'm floating in the ocean.

113.speaker: polar bear
113.character: 北極の海を泳ぎ回っていた頃を思い出すな
113.definition: It reminds me of when I was swimming around in the arctic ocean.

114.speaker: polar bear
114.character: 今度から　ここで北極気分を味わおうっと
114.definition: Now I'll enjoy that feeling from here.

116.speaker: sasako
116.definition: It snowed quite a bit today.

117.speaker: sasako
117.character: に　庭に何か巨大なものが
117.definition: S-Something very large is in the yard!

118.speaker: polar bear
118.character: あぁ　笹子さん　おはよう

120.speaker: polar bear
120.character: 今朝は快適な冷え具合だね

122.speaker: sasako
122.character: シロクマさん　さすが北極仕様ですね
122.definition: Mr. Polar Bear... Nothing less from someone from the Arctic...

123.speaker: everyone
123.character: パンダママのガーデニング

124.speaker: polar bear
124.character: あっ　グリズリー君　シロクマだけど

126.speaker: polar bear
126.character: グリズリー君　鏡餅
126.definition: Grizzly, should I grill the New Year's rice cakes or make them into ozouni soup?

127.speaker: grizzly
127.character: なんで俺に聞くんだよ

128.speaker: grizzly
128.character: 俺は冬眠中だって言ってんだろ
128.definition: I told you, I'm hibernating, damn it!

129.speaker: polar bear
129.character: どっちがいいか悩んでて 最近　眠れないんだけど
129.definition: I can't decide between the two and I've been losing sleep over this.

130.speaker: polar bear
130.character: どうすればいいと思う
130.definition: What do you think I should do?

131.speaker: grizzly
131.character: いいから俺を眠らせろ
131.definition: Shut up and let me sleep!

132.speaker: panda mama
132.character: 起きなさい　もうお昼よ

133.speaker: panda
133.character: もうちょっと寝かせてよ
133.definition: Let me sleep just a little longer...

134.speaker: panda mama
134.character: いいかげんにしなさい

135.speaker: panda mama
135.character: あなた　いったい一日どれだけ寝れば気が済むの
135.definition: How long do you have to sleep to be satisfied?

137.speaker: panda mama
137.character: まったく　そんなにいつも寝てばっかりで
137.definition: Goodness. You do nothing but sleep.

139.speaker: panda
139.character: お母さん　クマとかは冬眠じゃなくて冬ごもりって言うんだよ
139.definition: Mom, bears don't call it hibernating. They call it staying in for the winter.

142.speaker: panda
142.character: パンダは冬ごもりはできないって言われてるけど
142.definition: They say that pandas can't stay indoors for the winter,

143.speaker: panda
143.character: 僕　頑張って挑戦してみるよ
143.definition: but I'll do my best to try!

144.speaker: panda
144.character: じゃあ　春になったら起こしてね
144.definition: Okay, wake me up in the spring. Don't suck me up!

145.speaker: panda mama
145.character: さて　掃除が一段落したらと…
145.definition: Well, then... Since I'm done with the cleaning for now...

146.speaker: panda mama
146.character: しばし　私の大切な時間
146.definition: I'll take a moment to enjoy myself.

148.speaker: panda
148.character: また庭を耕してるんだ

149.speaker: panda
149.definition: She sure likes that. Oh, my.

150.speaker: panda mama
150.character: ガーデニングと呼んでちょうだい

151.speaker: panda mama
151.character: 最近は　花や木だけじゃなくて
151.definition: Lately, it's not just flowers and trees,

152.speaker: panda mama
152.character: 野菜なんかも作ってみたりしてるのよね
152.definition: but I've started growing vegetables, too.

153.speaker: panda mama
153.character: 野菜って　たくさん収穫できると食費も浮いて嬉しいわね
153.definition: It's nice when a lot of vegetables grow because we'll have so much more to eat.

154.speaker: panda mama
154.character: はぁ　お花と菜園とで結構　忙しいわ
154.definition: The flowers and the vegetable garden keep me rather busy.

155.speaker: panda mama
155.character: チュ　チューリップの芽がちぎれてる

157.speaker: panda
157.character: あ　それ　チューリップだったの

158.speaker: panda
158.character: 僕　ネギだと思って さっき食べちゃった
158.definition: I thought they were green onions and I ate them.

160.speaker: panda
160.character: どうりでネギの味じゃないと思った
160.definition: No wonder they didn't taste like green onions.

161.speaker: panda mama
161.definition: The green onions are over there!

163.speaker: panda mama
163.character: な　なんてことなの…

164.speaker: panda mama
164.character: 春になったら　かわいいお花がつくはずだったのに
164.definition: Cute little flowers should have bloomed in the spring.

166.speaker: panda mama
166.character: ターシャ・パンダーさんばりのお庭にするはずだったのに…
166.definition: And I wanted to make a garden like Ms. Tasha Panda.

167.speaker: panda mama
167.character: こんなお庭では　ターシャ・パンダーさんに顔向けできないわ
167.definition: With a garden like this, how will I ever face Ms. Tasha Panda?

168.speaker: panda mama
168.character: ああ　あの子ったら　バカ　バカ　バカ

169.speaker: penguin
169.character: いつ　むー　なな

170.speaker: penguin
170.character: おっと　さっきのそばに入ってたにしんは何匹だった
170.definition: Hey, how many sardines were in that soba?

173.speaker: penguin
173.definition: One... Ack! Hey! Don't butt in at the best part, Polar Bear!

175.speaker: penguin
175.character: ったく　ちゃんと聞いてたの

176.speaker: penguin
176.character: そういえば　２人とも一度も笑ってないよね
176.definition: Come to think of it, neither of you even laughed once, did you?

179.speaker: penguin
179.character: 笑いどころわかってないんじゃない
179.definition: I don't think you know where you're supposed to laugh.

180.speaker: penguin
180.definition: I guess I don't have a choice.

181.speaker: penguin
181.character: １０回目だけどもう一度　最初からやるよ
181.definition: This is the tenth time, but I'm starting from the top again.

183.speaker: sasako
183.character: あっ　パンダ君 いらっしゃい

184.speaker: polar bear
184.character: どうしたの　元気ないね
184.definition: What's the matter? You seem down.

185.speaker: penguin
185.character: うん…じゃあ　元気づけに　僕の落語を聞かせてあげるよ
185.definition: How about I cheer you up with one of my comedic stories?

186.speaker: polar bear
186.character: 聞かせないほうがいいかもね
186.definition: Maybe we should skip that. Why?!

188.speaker: panda
188.character: さっきお母さんの植えたチューリップを
188.definition: I accidentally ate my mom's tulips because

189.character: ネギと間違えて食べちゃったんだよ
189.definition: I thought they were green onions.

191.speaker: sasako
191.character: それはお母さん　怒ったんじゃない
191.definition: I'm guessing that your mom was a little mad about that.

192.speaker: panda
192.character: うん　だからここに逃げてきたの
192.definition: Yeah... that's why I ran away to here.

193.speaker: penguin
193.character: キミ　なんでも食べちゃうんだね

194.speaker: panda
194.character: それでね　シロクマ君
194.definition: So, I was wondering, Polar Bear...

196.speaker: panda
196.character: 代わりのお花 何か分けてくれない
196.definition: Could you spare some of your flowers?

197.speaker: polar bear
197.character: 食べたのって　どんなチューリップ
197.definition: What kind of tulips did you eat? I already ate them, so I have no idea. Oh, I see.

198.speaker: penguin
198.character: お母さんが喜びそうな花にしたらいいんじゃない
198.definition: How about picking out some flowers that your mom will like?

200.speaker: panda
200.character: でも　どんな花ならお母さん　喜ぶのかな
200.definition: But I wonder what kind of flowers she'll like.

202.speaker: rinrin
202.character: いらっしゃい　パンダ君

203.speaker: rinrin
203.definition: What can I get you today?

204.speaker: rinrin
204.character: ほら　笹があるよ すっごくおいしいよ
204.definition: Look! I've got bamboo grass, too! It's scrumptious!

205.speaker: panda
205.character: 別にリンリンに用はないやい
205.definition: I don't need anything from you, Rin Rin.

206.speaker: rinrin
206.definition: Oh, I see... Don't be like that, Panda.

207.speaker: penguin
207.character: 今日は用があって来たんでしょ
207.definition: You came here because you need somethig, right?

210.speaker: penguin
210.character: だから　どんな花を植えたら

211.character: パンダ君のお母さんの機嫌が直るかを知りたくて
211.definition: so you could maybe help us pick out some flowers

212.character: この店に連れてきたんだよ
212.definition: that might cheer his mom up. You garden at home, too, right? So do you know something my mom would like? I might know...

213.character: でも　パンダ君のお母さんの機嫌を直すには
213.definition: But would it be enough to just plant flowers your mom may like?

214.speaker: penguin
214.character: それも　そうだよね

218.speaker: panda
218.character: 昨日は　チューリップ食べちゃってごめんなさい
218.definition: I'm really sorry for eating your tulips yesterday. Oh.

219.speaker: panda
219.character: 別のお花を植えたので許してほしいです
219.definition: I planted some other flowers, so please forgive me.

220.speaker: panda mama
220.character: わかったわ　見せてちょうだい
220.definition: Oh, all right. Show them to me. He should be showing her the flowers right about now.

221.speaker: rinrin
221.character: お花　喜んでもらえてればいいんですが…

223.speaker: sasako
223.character: 早く結果が知りたいですね
223.definition: I'd love to hear the results soon.

224.speaker: penguin
224.character: そうだ パンダ君の結果を待ってる間
224.definition: Oh, I know. While we're waiting for Panda's results,

225.speaker: penguin
225.character: 僕が落語を聞かせてあげようか
225.definition: I'll do some of my comedic storytelling.

228.speaker: penguin
228.character: じゃ　始めるよ お題は『にしんそば』
228.definition: All right, here we go. The title is Sardine Soba.

229.speaker: penguin
229.character: ある晩のこと　そば屋が屋台を引いてるってえと
229.definition: One night, a soba stand owner was setting up,

230.speaker: penguin
230.character: 現れた客が声をかけて
230.definition: when a customer called out, "Hey, soba stand owner..."

231.speaker: polar bear
231.character: お後が　よろしいようで

232.speaker: penguin
232.definition: Hey! I just started, Polar Bear!

233.speaker: penguin
233.character: いいや　カフェモカおかわり
233.definition: Never mind. Can I get another café mocha?

235.speaker: panda
235.definition: Over here. Oh, some wild chrysanthemums and purples pansies?

236.speaker: panda mama
236.character: ずいぶん渋い取り合わせね

237.speaker: panda
237.character: お母さん　ここに上がって見て

239.speaker: panda mama
239.character: わ…　私の顔になってるわ

240.speaker: panda
240.definition: I wonder... if she likes them...

241.speaker: panda mama
241.character: ターシャ・パンダーさんのようにはならなかったけど…
241.definition: It didn't end up like Ms. Tasha Panda's,

242.speaker: panda mama
242.character: でも　私らしいすてきなお庭になったわ
242.definition: but it's become my very own one-of-a-kind garden.

244.speaker: panda
244.character: ペンギンさん　ペンギンさん

245.speaker: penguin
245.definition: What is it, Panda? I'll give you one minute, so show me everything you've got.

246.speaker: penguin
246.character: それは調整しなくていいかな
246.definition: I'd rather not give that a try.

247.speaker: panda
247.character: ペンギンさんのすべてって　一分もないんだね
247.definition: I guess everything you have doesn't take a whole minute...

248.speaker: penguin
248.character: 僕　そういうニュアンスで言ったかな
248.definition: Is that what I was hinting at?

249.speaker: sasako
249.character: 来週のしろくまカフェは

250.speaker: penguin
250.character: 攻め込むね　笹子さん
250.definition: Butting right in I see, Miss Sasako...

252.speaker: polar bear
252.character: 来週のとっとこしろくまカフェは
252.definition: Next week's Tottoko Polar Bear's Café

254.speaker: polar bear
254.character: しろくまイライブンは
